shorts.title: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.2M in health care costs
shorts.title_distilled: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.
shorts.description: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs

shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: Penguins hop back into first place in Atlantic
shorts.title_distilled: Penguins hop back into first place in Atlantic.
shorts.description: The Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins are back in first place in the Atlantic Division. The Pens jumped out to a two-goal lead and added two empty-net goals in a 4-1 win over the Providence Bruins on Wednesday night in a battle of the top two teams in the division. The locals now own a 3-1 edge in the season series with the Bruins. Wilkes-Barre/Scranton outshot Providence, 37-24, and got a 36-save performance from Sergei Murashov for the victory. The Penguins wasted little time getting on the board as Joona Koppanen scored his sixth goal of the year just 1 minute, 52 seconds […]
shorts.content: The Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins are back in first place in the Atlantic Division. The Pens jumped out to a two-goal lead and added two empty-net goals in a 4-1 win over the Providence Bruins on Wednesday night in a battle of the top two teams in the division. The locals now own a 3-1 edge in the season series with the Bruins. Wilkes-Barre/Scranton outshot Providence, 37-24, and got a 36-save performance from Sergei Murashov for the victory. The Penguins wasted little time getting on the board as Joona Koppanen scored his sixth goal of the year just 1 minute, 52 seconds […]
shorts.content_distilled: Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins are back in first place in the Atlantic Division.

shorts.title: COLLEGE BASKETBALL: Royals’ revival continues with win over Lycoming (Updated)
shorts.title_distilled: COLLEGE BASKETBALL: Royals’ revival continues with win over Lycoming .
shorts.description: SCRANTON — Jon Spatola has seen the ups and downs during his basketball career at the University of Scranton. As a freshman, the point guard from Marlboro, New Jersey, was part of a Landmark Conference championship team that advanced to the second round of NCAA Division III tournament. But Scranton won only four games his sophomore season and 12 games his junior year. This season, however, the Royals are contending again. Their revival continued Wednesday night with a 77-72 victory over a scrappy Lycoming College squad at the John Long Center. It is their 10th straight win, improving them to […]
shorts.content: SCRANTON — Jon Spatola has seen the ups and downs during his basketball career at the University of Scranton. As a freshman, the point guard from Marlboro, New Jersey, was part of a Landmark Conference championship team that advanced to the second round of NCAA Division III tournament. But Scranton won only four games his sophomore season and 12 games his junior year. This season, however, the Royals are contending again. Their revival continued Wednesday night with a 77-72 victory over a scrappy Lycoming College squad at the John Long Center. It is their 10th straight win, improving them to […]

shorts.title: A toast to Noon Year’s Eve: Kids ring in 2026 at local libraries
shorts.title_distilled: toast to Noon Year’s Eve: Kids ring in 2026 at local libraries.
shorts.description: Valley Community Library in Peckville and the Lackawanna County Children’s Library in Scranton ushered in 2026 with Noon Year’s Eve parties on Dec. 31. The midday celebrations featured a countdown to noon, giving kids an opportunity to ring in the new year even if they didn’t stay up until midnight. At the Valley Community Library, children read books about New Year’s, made “toast” and participated in a New Year bingo scavenger hunt in addition to coloring and dancing. The Lackawanna County Children’s Library celebration included story time, a dance party, noisemakers and sparkling juice.
shorts.content: Valley Community Library in Peckville and the Lackawanna County Children’s Library in Scranton ushered in 2026 with Noon Year’s Eve parties on Dec. 31. The midday celebrations featured a countdown to noon, giving kids an opportunity to ring in the new year even if they didn’t stay up until midnight. At the Valley Community Library, children read books about New Year’s, made “toast” and participated in a New Year bingo scavenger hunt in addition to coloring and dancing. The Lackawanna County Children’s Library celebration included story time, a dance party, noisemakers and sparkling juice.
shorts.content_distilled: Valley Community Library in Peckville and the Lackawanna County Children’s Library in Scranton ushered in 2026 with Noon Year’s Eve parties on Dec.
